Beinn Bhreac

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Beinn Bhreac is a lowly Munro by Cairngorms standards, rising at the southern end of a vast boggy moorland. It enjoys a fine setting high above beautiful Glen Derry.

 You have not climbed Beinn Bhreac.

Region: Cairngorms

Altitude: 931 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.60/5
Rating: 2.6/5 (65 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Beinn a' Chaorainn and Beinn Bhreac from Linn of Dee

Other routes and challenges

Beinn Bhreac is almost invariably climbed by the route given above. The other theoretical possibly is an approach along Gleann Quoich to reach the Dubh-Ghleann.

It and Beinn a' Chaorainn are linked at a high level by a huge expanse of exposed tundra to the great plateau of Beinn a' Bhuird.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Braemar Hotels

Braemar B&B

Braemar cottages

Cairngorms hostels
